t: And Jacob went on his way, and the angels of God met him.
c: {'ref': 'Psalm 34:7', 'note': 'The angel of the LORD encamps round about them that fear him'}
{'ref': 'Hebrews 1:14', 'note': 'Angels are ministering spirits'}

t: And when Jacob saw them, he said, This is God’s host: and he called the name of that place Mahanaim.
c: {'ref': '2 Kings 6:17', 'note': 'The mountain full of horses and chariots of fire'}
{'ref': 'Genesis 28:12', 'note': 'Jacob’s earlier encounter with angels'}

t: And Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother unto the land of Seir, the country of Edom.
c: {'ref': 'Genesis 27:41', 'note': 'Esau’s anger'}
{'ref': 'Genesis 36:8', 'note': 'Esau is Edom and dwelt in mount Seir'}

t: And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye speak unto my lord Esau; Thy servant Jacob saith thus, I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed there until now:
c: {'ref': 'Genesis 28:5', 'note': 'Jacob sent to Laban'}

t: And I have oxen, and asses, flocks, and menservants, and womenservants: and I have sent to tell my lord, that I may find grace in thy sight.
c: {'ref': 'Genesis 30:43', 'note': 'Jacob increased exceedingly'}

t: And the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, We came to thy brother Esau, and also he cometh to meet thee, and four hundred men with him.
c: {'ref': 'Genesis 33:1', 'note': 'Esau approaches with four hundred men'}

t: Then Jacob was greatly afraid and distressed: and he divided the people that was with him, and the flocks, and herds, and the camels, into two bands;
c: {'ref': 'Psalm 56:3', 'note': 'What time I am afraid, I will trust in thee'}

t: And said, If Esau come to the one company, and smite it, then the other company which is left shall escape.
c: {'ref': 'Proverbs 22:3', 'note': 'The prudent foresees evil and hides himself'}

t: And Jacob said, O God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, the LORD which saidst unto me, Return unto thy country, and to thy kindred, and I will deal well with thee:
c: {'ref': 'Genesis 31:3', 'note': 'Return and I will be with thee'}

t: I am not worthy of the least of all the mercies, and of all the truth, which thou hast showed unto thy servant; for with my staff I passed over this Jordan; and now I am become two bands.
c: {'ref': 'Psalm 103:10', 'note': 'He hath not dealt with us after our sins'}

t: Deliver me, I pray thee, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau: for I fear him, lest he will come and smite me, and the mother with the children.
c: {'ref': 'Psalm 34:4', 'note': 'I sought the LORD, and he heard me'}

t: And thou saidst, I will surely do thee good, and make thy seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.
c: {'ref': 'Genesis 22:17', 'note': 'Seed as the sand of the sea'}

t: And he lodged there that same night; and took of that which came to his hand a present for Esau his brother;
c: {'ref': 'Proverbs 18:16', 'note': 'A gift makes room'}

t: Two hundred she goats, and twenty he goats, two hundred ewes, and twenty rams,
Thirty milch camels with their colts, forty kine, and ten bulls, twenty she asses, and ten foals.
And he delivered them into the hand of his servants, every drove by themselves; and said unto his servants, Pass over before me, and put a space betwixt drove and drove.
And he commanded the foremost, saying, When Esau my brother meeteth thee, and asketh thee, saying, Whose art thou? and whither goest thou? and whose are these before thee?
Then thou shalt say, They be thy servant Jacob’s; it is a present sent unto my lord Esau: and, behold, also he is behind us.
And so commanded he the second, and the third, and all that followed the droves, saying, On this manner shall ye speak unto Esau, when ye find him.

And say ye moreover, Behold, thy servant Jacob is behind us. For he said, I will appease him with the present that goeth before me, and afterward I will see his face; peradventure he will accept of me.
c: {'ref': 'Proverbs 21:14', 'note': 'A gift in secret pacifies anger'}

t: So went the present over before him: and himself lodged that night in the company.
And he rose up that night, and took his two wives, and his two womenservants, and his eleven sons, and passed over the ford Jabbok.
c: {'ref': 'Genesis 35:23-26', 'note': 'The sons of Jacob'}

t: And he took them, and sent them over the brook, and sent over that he had.
And Jacob was left alone; and there wrestled a man with him until the breaking of the day.
c: {'ref': 'Hosea 12:3-4', 'note': 'He had power over the angel and prevailed'}

t: And when he saw that he prevailed not against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh; and the hollow of Jacob’s thigh was out of joint, as he wrestled with him.
c: {'ref': '2 Corinthians 12:9', 'note': 'Strength in weakness (thematic)'}

t: And he said, Let me go, for the day breaketh. And he said, I will not let thee go, except thou bless me.
c: {'ref': 'Hebrews 11:6', 'note': 'He is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him'}

t: And he said unto him, What is thy name? And he said, Jacob.
And he said, Thy name shall be called no more Jacob, but Israel: for as a prince hast thou power with God and with men, and hast prevailed.
c: {'ref': 'Genesis 35:10', 'note': 'Name confirmed as Israel'}

t: And Jacob asked him, and said, Tell me, I pray thee, thy name. And he said, Wherefore is it that thou dost ask after my name? And he blessed him there.
c: {'ref': 'Judges 13:17-18', 'note': 'Why askest thou thus after my name?'}

t: And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: for I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved.
c: {'ref': 'Exodus 33:20', 'note': 'No man shall see me and live'}

t: And as he passed over Penuel the sun rose upon him, and he halted upon his thigh.
Therefore the children of Israel eat not of the sinew which shrank, which is upon the hollow of the thigh, unto this day: because he touched the hollow of Jacob’s thigh in the sinew that shrank.
c: {'ref': 'Leviticus 11:3', 'note': 'Food distinctions in Israel (broader context)'}
